messages.messageBody:
Probably because I wrote the web address at the end of a sentence and
the period threw things off. Let me try this again:

http://www.letterlane.com

That should work.

Renee

--- In Unschooling-dotcom@y..., "mom2spirited2" <mom2spirited2@y...>
wrote:
> My husband and I are homeschooling our 8 1/2 year old, and, based on
> our child's many-year obsession with the alphabet, we have been
> working on creating some educational resources. We will eventually
> produce CD-ROMs, but now we are just starting to put up a web site.
> It is at http://www.letterlane.com We would really like some input
> from parents about a couple of things.
> First, we are looking for good quality, noncommercial links for each
> letter of the alphabet. Secondly, we want this to be truly
> multicultural and inclusive, so we are open to suggestions for names
> for the characters from E through Z that would reflect the diversity
> within the United States.
>
> Thanks in advance!
>
> Renee

messages.subject: Need input
messages.msgSnippet: My husband and I are homeschooling our 8 1/2 year old, and, based on our child s many-year obsession with the alphabet, we have been working on creating some
messages.messageBody:
My husband and I are homeschooling our 8 1/2 year old, and, based on
our child's many-year obsession with the alphabet, we have been
working on creating some educational resources. We will eventually
produce CD-ROMs, but now we are just starting to put up a web site.
It is at http://www.letterlane.com We would really like some input
from parents about a couple of things.
First, we are looking for good quality, noncommercial links for each
letter of the alphabet. Secondly, we want this to be truly
multicultural and inclusive, so we are open to suggestions for names
for the characters from E through Z that would reflect the diversity
within the United States.

Thanks in advance!

Renee
